name: Temple of Aeryn - Demo
description:
>Don't be confused by the first screen, it's a little joke loading screen, just click it away<

If you like it, please consider supporting the Kickstarter

Temple of Aeryn invites you to unravel the mysteries that are taking place in a world full of magic and fable creatures. You're dropped in the middle of the scenario, not knowing who to trust or where to seek shelter. But you're not alone and you're not helpless. As the shaman of your clan, you have the power to summon mighty beasts that fight by your side.

During a viscous attack on your village, your spell book was burned, which left you without any spells. You must follow in the footsteps of your ancestors to reclaim the lost magic wisdom, because only then you will be able to fulfill your destiny. 

In the demo you can find one spell, as of now.

Exploration

Travel and reach your destination in the map overview but keep in mind, planning ahead is crucial. Rations are consumed during your journey, travelling on an empty stomach will cost you health.

Gather food from searching the area or buy supplies in shops.

Pay attention to clues in your surrounding in order to find special areas. 

Turn-Based Combat

Temple of Aeryn is a mix of story driven adventure and strategic, turn-based combat with deck building mechanics.

Preparing spells for combat:

It's all about spells! They have to be found, bought, or looted during your adventure. On each round in combat, up to 2 spells can be prepared. 

The full saga contains 336 spells, spanning over a total of 10 magic schools and 4 unique characters. 

The Story so far

The tribe of the wood elves is seeking help from the ruling human race to protect them from the ravaging nearby hordes of the necromancer. 

The realm is beautiful as it is hostile, but not just for the elves. Unknown to most, a cataclysmic event is about to unfold which threatens the life of every creature in the kingdom. 

Features 

The features in the full version:

  • Lovely handcrafted, C64 art style that enables me to implement the content on my own and engage the player in a meaningful way.
  • Navigating a enormous map with hidden, narrative related paths and secrets.
  • A thrilling story with it's own twists and turns.
  • NPC's with their own schedule that you can encounter anywhere in the world.
  • Day and night cycle effecting game dynamics.
  • Multiple endings depending on which decisions were made.
  • Finding secrets is a core mechanic that enables defeating stronger enemies in order to progress in the story.
  • No mindless grinding. Success in combat is determined by logic and strategy, not how many times you pressed a button.
  • Tons of spells which influence the outcome of battle, organized in a spell book. 
  • World altering events and spells that are major turning points in the game.
